sections.name: Gallowdead
The Hooked
sections.html: All gallowdead have massive hooks through their chests. For the oldest gallowdead, their hook signifies that they hung from the fabled Gallowspire. These gallowdead are even more powerful, bleeding raw necromantic power into the air around them. How Tar-Baphon creates new gallowdead with hooks of similar power, after the destruction of Gallowspire, is a topic of great interest to those who oppose the Whispering Tyrant.

The first gallowdead were hung from enormous, hooked chains from atop the Whispering Tyrant's prison, Gallowspire, and magically bonded to their chains after death. After Gallowspire's destruction, the gallowdead who remained were left to wander the ruins.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don't benefit from healing effects.

interaction_abilities.name: Eyes of the Tyrant
interaction_abilities.text: Gallowdead are the eyes and ears of the Whispering Tyrant, so Tar-Baphon can see through them at any time as long as they're on the same plane of existence as him.

automatic_abilities.name: Aura of Whispers
automatic_abilities.failure: The creature is frightened 2 and stunned 1.
automatic_abilities.critical_failure: The creature is frightened 3 and stunned 3.

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can't hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

automatic_abilities.text: A gallowdead is surrounded by an aura of blasphemous whispers. A creature who hears them understands them to be mutterings of its most closely guarded secrets and private failings laid bare. A creature that first enters the area must attempt a DC 34 Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to aura of whispers for 1 minute. The frightened condition from this aura can't be reduced while in the aura.

automatic_abilities.name: Chains of the Dead
automatic_abilities.text: The spiked chain of a gallowdead is wrapped around and through their body, imbuing it with foul necromantic powers. The spiked chain can't be disarmed, deals an additional weapon die of damage, and has a greater reach while wielded by the gallowdead.

automatic_abilities.name: Gallow Curse

traits.name: Curse
traits.text:
A curse is an effect that places some long-term affliction on a creature. Curses are always magical and are typically the result of a spell or trap. Effects with this trait can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses.   
  
Afflictions with this trait are manifestations of potent ill will. A curse either lasts a specified amount of time or can be removed only by certain actions a character must perform or conditions they must meet. A curse with stages follows the rules for afflictions. (_Gamemastery Guide_ pg. 251)

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

automatic_abilities.text: Those who destroy gallowdead are subject to a powerful death curse. When a creature reduces a gallowdead to 0 HP, the creature must attempt a DC 34 Will save. A creature that fails this saving throw is doomed 1 and can't remove the condition until the curse has been lifted.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Trip
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Trip using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

ability.name: Chain Capture
ability.trigger: The gallowdead critically hits a target with their spiked chain
ability.effect: The gallowdead attempts an Athletics check to Grapple the target. On a success, the gallowdead can also pull the target adjacent toward them to the distance the gallowdead chooses. Most often, a gallowdead chooses to pull a creature close enough that it's in their reach and out of defensive position, but so the creature still can't reach the gallowdead's body. At the start of the gallowdead's next turn, if the target hasn't Escaped, the target takes the damage of a spiked chain Strike, and the chain releases the creature.

ability.name: Charge Chain

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Negative
traits.text: Effects with this trait heal undead creatures with negative energy, deal negative damage to living creatures, or manipulate negative energy. Planes with this trait are vast, empty reaches that suck the life from the living. Creatures with this trait are natives of the Negative Energy Plane. They can survive the basic environmental effects of the Negative Energy Plane.

ability.effect: The gallowdead imbues their chain with necromantic power. The gallowdead chooses to make their next Strike with the chain this turn either deal an additional 4d6 negative damage or have 120-foot reach.
